text:
CPU table reports overall CPU usage, but it may be averaged or normalized across cores.

Processes table shows per-process CPU usage, which can sum up to more than CPU's table due to different calculation methods.

CPU table may exclude certain short-lived or low-priority processes, leading to lower reported values.

Per-process usage might be counted as a fraction of a single core, whereas CPU table considers total system load.

Differences in sampling intervals and CPU accounting methods can cause processes statistcs to appear higher than CPU's.
